contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Province Spain | name = Province of Zaragoza | native_name = | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_flag = Flag of Zaragoza province (with coat of arms).svg | image_shield = Escudo de la Provincia de Zaragoza.svg | motto = | anthem = | image_map = Zaragoza in Spain.svg | latd = 41|latm = 35|latNS = N | longd = 1|longm = 00|longEW = W | coordinates_type = region:ES_type:adm2nd_source:GNS-enwiki | autonomous_community = {{flagicon|Aragon}} [[Aragon]] | capital = [[Zaragoza]] | government_type = | president = | president_party = | area_total_km2 = 17274 | area_rank = 4 | area_percent = 3.42 | elevation_m = | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Catalan language|Catalan]] | population_total = 973252 | population_as_of = 2010 | population_rank = 15 | population_demonym = Zaragozano/Zaragozana | population_percent = | website = }} [[File:0849 pilar ebro 2004.png|thumb|left|The [[Ebro River]] in [[Zaragoza]] city with the [[Basilica of Our Lady of the Pillar]] on the right]] [[File:Moncayo desde Tarazona.jpg|thumb|left|The [[Moncayo Massif]] seen from [[Tarazona]]]] '''Zaragoza''' ({{IPA-es|θaɾaˈɣoθa}}), also called '''Saragossa''' in [[English language|English]],<ref>''[[Encyclopædia Britannica]]'', [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/655938/Zaragoza Zaragoza (conventional Saragossa)]</ref> is a [[Provinces of Spain|province]] of northern [[Spain]], in the central part of the [[Autonomous communities of Spain|autonomous community]] of [[Aragon]]. Its capital is [[Zaragoza, Spain|Zaragoza]], which is also the capital of the autonomous community. Other towns in Zaragoza include [[Calatayud]], [[Borja, Aragon|Borja]], [[La Almunia de Doña Godina]], [[Ejea de los Caballeros]] and [[Tarazona]]. Its area is [[1 E10 m²|17,274 km²]]. Its population is 973,252 (2010), of whom nearly three-quarters live in the capital, and its population density is 50.95/km². It contains 292 municipalities, of which more than half are villages with fewer than 300 people. The main language throughout the province is [[Spanish language|Spanish]], although [[Catalan language|Catalan]] is official in the [[Bajo Aragón-Caspe/Baix Aragó-Casp|Bajo Aragón-Caspe]] comarca and in [[Mequinenza]] municipality. ==Geography== The province of Zaragoza is bordered by the provinces of [[Lleida Province|Lleida]], [[Tarragona Province|Tarragona]], [[Teruel Province|Teruel]], [[Guadalajara Province|Guadalajara]], [[Soria Province|Soria]], [[La Rioja Province (Spain)|La Rioja]], [[Navarre Province|Navarre]], and [[Huesca Province|Huesca]]. The southern and western side of the province is in the [[mountainous]] [[Sistema Ibérico]] area and includes its highest point, the [[Moncayo Massif|Moncayo]], while the northern end reaches the [[Pre-Pyrenees]]. The [[Ebro River]] crosses the province from west to east. ==Comarcas== [[List of Aragonese comarcas|Comarcas]] in the Zaragoza province: {|class=wikitable !No.!!Name !!Capital |- |5||[[Cinco Villas, Aragon|Cinco Villas]] || [[Ejea de los Caballeros]] |- | 12 || [[Tarazona y el Moncayo]] || [[Tarazona]] |- |13 || [[Campo de Borja]] || [[Borja, Zaragoza|Borja]] |- |14 ||[[Aranda (comarca)|Aranda]] || [[Illueca]] |- |15 || [[Ribera Alta del Ebro]] || [[Alagón, Zaragoza|Alagón]] |- |16 || [[Valdejalón]] || [[La Almunia de Doña Godina]] |- |17 || [[Zaragoza (comarca)|Zaragoza]] || [[Zaragoza]] |- |18 || [[Ribera Baja del Ebro]] ||[[Quinto, Aragon|Quinto]] |- |19 || [[Bajo Aragón-Caspe/Baix Aragó-Casp]] || [[Caspe]] |- | 20|| [[Comunidad de Calatayud]] ||[[Calatayud]] |- |21 || [[Campo de Cariñena]] || [[Cariñena]] |- |22 ||[[Campo de Belchite]] || [[Belchite]] |- |24 || [[Campo de Daroca]] || [[Daroca]] |} The following comarcas having their capital in [[Huesca Province]] include municipal terms within Zaragoza Province: * [[Bajo Cinca]]: [[Mequinenza]]. * [[Hoya de Huesca]]: [[Murillo de Gállego]] and [[Santa Eulalia de Gállego]]. * [[Jacetania]]: [[Artieda]], [[Mianos]], [[Salvatierra de Esca]] and [[Sigüés]]. * [[Monegros]]: [[La Almolda]], [[Bujaraloz]], [[Farlete]], [[Leciñena]], [[Monegrillo]] and [[Perdiguera]]. == See also == *[[List of municipalities in Zaragoza]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category|Province of Zaragoza}} *[http://www.dpz.es/ Official website] <BR> {{Provinces of Aragon}} {{Provinces of Spain}} <BR> {{Municipalities in Zaragoza}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zaragoza, Province of}} [[Category:Province of Zaragoza| ]]
